definitions.text: the unlimited expanse in which everything is located
examples: they tested his ability to locate objects in space
the boundless regions of the infinite

definitions.text: an empty area (usually bounded in some way between things)
examples: the architect left space in front of the building
they stopped at an open space in the jungle

definitions.text: an area reserved for some particular purpose
any location outside the Earth's atmosphere
examples: the astronauts walked in outer space without a tether
the first major milestone in space exploration was in 1957, when the USSR's Sputnik 1 orbited the Earth

definitions.text: a blank character used to separate successive words in writing or printing
examples: he said the space is the most important character in the alphabet
the distance from birth to death
it all happened in the space of 10 minutes
write your name in the space provided

definitions.text: one of the areas between or below or above the lines of a musical staff
examples: the spaces are the notes F-A-C-E

definitions.text: (printing) a block of type without a raised letter; used for spacing between words or sentences

examples: Space the interviews so that you have some time between the different candidates
